comment: She is genuienly so kind and sweet!!! She is clearly very passionate about the material and it rubs off on the students. Quizzes are a bit difficult but nothing crazy, no exams but four assignments. I loved the class but I'm not gonna lie I took her at 8am and couldn't consistently make it to class- grade dropped a letter because of it.
The class itself was easy, and she made lectures fun and engaging, but if you take her 8am, be prepared, your grade will suffer a lot if you skip even a few times.
very easy class, hardest part was waking up for it

4 assignments that she reviews before you submit to ensure you get a 100, open note quizzes, and no exams. Dr. Dudenhoeffer is one of the nicest professors, she responds quickly with emails and makes lectures very engaging to learn. Attendance is mandatory, she does not post slides online, I looked forward going to her class even at 8 am.

Take her!! Literally the most amazing Professor I've ever had! Her class is super easy but unfortunately I took her 8am so I couldn't always make it to class on time but everything in the notes is how your quizzes are. She is also the kindest person ever. I would definitely take her again! And always attend lectures!!
Super chill, super accessible, and honestly just a blast of a class, even though I took it at 8am.

Relatively easy class with a reasonable workload of 5 quizzes that's open notebook and 4 assignments that's not too hard to do and she's open to giving feedback. I recommend attending class to get the notes for the quizzes. I don't recommend getting the textbook b/c I never used it and will be a waste of $. Overall I highly recommend taking her!

She is very nice and you can tell how passionate she is about what she does. Unfortunately, I took this class at 8 AM but she still managed to make each lecture very inclusive and fun. You will be graded by quizzes and projects. Take the notes she gives, and the assignments will be extremely easy.

While she is nice and funny in class, her class is difficult to take due to a lack of organization. You never knew what would be on the test, she was never clear on definitions, and her slides were always a mess. Multiple times she was late and unprepared and her slides were wrong. On two tests I had to correct her on what I got right and wrong.

She is literally the sweetest lady on the planet. She has a lot of energy but its cool! Quizzes arent that hard but you have to be there and get the material in order to pass bc she does nothing through D2L except VCIAs. Not a harsh grader but a format stickler

took her for COM 2033, very easy class and the assignments are self-explanitory. Though attendance isn't mandatory, it'll be hard to pass the quizzes on the lectures she gives. Just go to class. Our final is literally the movie Scott Pilgrim v the world...easy A. Just take the class, she's funny too.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: She was amazing!! So kind and always always always wanted to make sure we understood what she was talking about and made sure if we had questions. We only had to do 4 speeches and literally, all you had to do was follow the outlines given in the textbook/workbook. I had her for public speaking and it was good. She took attendance every day. 10/10!!

Literally an angel. Shes the most caring Professor Ive ever had and I would take her for every class if I could. The speeches are easy and she gives very helpful feedback from her and classmates. She teaches a lot about speech anxiety and makes it fun and as stress-free as possible to present!
Best Professor for Public Speaking at KSU. Do not hesitate to take her.
The best professor I've had. This sounds like fake review but it's all genuine; don't know what professor can top this one. Lenient with many things, understanding, and passionate all in one!

She's the sweetest lady. And she made this class so easy. My favorite professor I've ever had! I couldn't recommend more. You'll love her. The course workbook is also a very reliable tool and is worth buying.

I love her! There are 5 speeches & she makes you feel so comfortable in class, whether you're nervous or not. The class really goes by quick & you meet amazing people too. Most of the speeches are 3-4 minutes, and we broke up into groups of A1,A2,B1,B2 on last name for presentations. It's mostly online, but in person for speeches. Recommend her!
